Class InputFrame

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  InputFrame
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class InputFrame
extends javax.swing.JPanel

COPYRIGHT (C) 2005 Rob Bauer. All Rights Reserved.

Class used to build the game input options. The user has the option of specifying the file manually, or by selecting the file from a file dialog.

Swing components were developed from studying Sun's Java Swing Components Tutorials http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/uiswing/components/components.html

This class modelled after the same one used for the Slicing Floor Plan.

Version:
1.0 2005-NOV-08
Author:
Rob Bauer
See Also:

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

InputFrame

public InputFrame()
Build the input frame using Swing components. Get the file name to read the castle contents.

InputFrame

public InputFrame(boolean forceWindow)
Build the input frame using Swing components. Get the file name to read the castle contents. Let the user override the default file name. When forceWindow is set to true, then present the file input pane regardless if a castle.dat exists in the working directory.

Method Detail

setupPanel

public void setupPanel()
Setup the input panel. This panel is used to get the file path information from the user/player.

newTextFieldLabel

private javax.swing.JLabel newTextFieldLabel(javax.swing.JTextField textField,
                                             java.lang.String label)
Setup a new label and associate it with the given text field.

Parameters:
textField - JTextField to assign the label to
label - String containing the label's text
Returns:
JLabel contains the new label

startGame

private void startGame(java.lang.String filename)
Start the adventure game by supplying the castle.dat file to load.

Parameters:
filename - castle.dat file to load

validateInput

private java.lang.String validateInput()
Validate the user's input. Here, just make sure they either entered a file name or entered a string containing the floor plan.

Returns:
String containing an error message if there is one. Otherwise it'll be null.

addLabelTextRows

private void addLabelTextRows(javax.swing.JLabel[] labels,
                              javax.swing.JTextField[] textFields,
                              javax.swing.JButton[] buttons,
                              java.awt.GridBagLayout gridbag,
                              java.awt.Container container)
Add labels, text fields, and buttons on a per row basis. Each row gets a label, then a text field, and then a button. The text field will grow or shrink as the window size changes.

Parameters:
labels - Array of JLabels
textFields - Array of JTextFields
buttons - Array of JButtons
gridbag - the gridbag layout to use
container - Container to place components into

testFile

private boolean testFile(java.lang.String filename)
Test that a file exists and is readable.

Parameters:
filename - File name to test
Returns:
true if readable otherwise false

getAdventureGame

public AdventureGame getAdventureGame()
Return the reference to the current adventure game.

Returns:
the adventure game current in play
